data: May be performed by RNs in the Emergency Departments
Refer to Decision Support Tool (DST): Treatment of Urticaria (Hives)
This NIA does not reflect urgent management of anaphylaxis. Refer to PED NIA Anaphylaxis: Initial Treatment

Indications: 
- Must be 6 months of age or older
- Must be under care of emergency physician
- Has not had antihistamine in the last 6 hours

Contraindications:
- Hypersensitivity to cetirizine or loratadine, acute wheeze or respiratory distress, cardiac disease, hypertension, glaucoma, urinary obstruction, gastrointestinal obstruction, seizure disorders and liver disease
- Allergy to the drug
2.5 mg, PO, once, drug form: oral liq, first dose NOW [6 - 13 months]
2.5 mg, PO, once, drug form,tab, first dose NOW [6 - 13 months]
5 mg, PO, once, drug form: oral liq, first dose NOW [1 - 6 year]
5 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose NOW [1 - 6 year]
10 mg, PO, once, drug form:oral liq, first dose NOW [Greater Than or Equal To 6 year]
10 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose NOW [Greater Than or Equal To 6 year]
2.5 mg, PO, once, drug form: oral liq, first dose NOW 96-24 month)
5 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose NOW (2-5 year)
5 mg, PO, once, drug form:oral liq, first dose NOW (2-5 year)
10 mg, PO, once, drug form: tab, first dose NOW (Greater than or equal to 5 year)
10mg, PO, once, drug form:oral liq, first dose NOW (Greater than or equal to 5 year)
PED NIA ED Treatment of Urticaria (Hives) has been initiated
